TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program 1.0.3 is now live!

Articles.Content:
> 
> Here are the new turbo jet engine exhaust fx (still asymmetric flame-outs though):
> [http://i.imgur.com/rpkbTzp.png](http://i.imgur.com/rpkbTzp.png)

Oh my gosh...

**It's** **so beautiful!!!**
Nice plesent surprise. Hope you guys did not lose any sleep in getting it ready.
I thought it would come out much later this week. Thanks!

Questions. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

1. Do mod parts need updating for all the new heating system values?

2. What was done to prevent which science lab exploits?
Ack. I had just installed about 80 mods in..time to wait for update I guess....
reentry now raises adrenalin a bit more than before... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
So with the new heat model and radiators, will we get a thermal vacuum chamber at the KSC to test them on the ground?

\*drools over jet FX\*

But come on, if they can add *that* in, then where's our ion engine FX? NFP does it perfectly, that would be fine.
Would love to see the KSC collision bug with wing parts fixed.

> 
> kiwi1960: 1.0.3 has a lot of fixes, and nothing that should break mods, I'd really suggest upgrading. You might want to wait a few days to make sure all plugins update, but really...please do reconsider. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I will reconsider.... but I'll back up the entire game first... after I have retrieved Valentina. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Outstanding. Thanks, Squad!
Ã‚Â¡Muchos Gracias, Squad!
Well, the patch broke two of my rockets, rendering them completely uncontrollable.

Just in time to add radiators to my shuttle.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Ack. I had just installed about 80 mods in..time to wait for update I guess....

Me too, then I tried to think of all the mods I installed and the features I installed, I kept only that.

First two flights in Career normal.

1. Flea set to 33% with pod and two Goo capsules. Hit almost 8,000 meters. Gathered 33 science points.

2. Second flight with unlocked BACC SRB at about 45%, four fins, decoupler under pod. That went way suborbital to almost 170,000 feet, wasn't expecting that kind of performance. A harry ride due to frictional heating before burnout and a hot reentry, but safe recovery. Flight was stable with the fins even at the supersonic speed.

Back to more testing.

> 
> Those new engine effects looking good:
> [http://i.imgur.com/dhyTRWE.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/dhyTRWE.jpg)
> 
> The Not-Rocomax Micro-adapter has uses! Think of the possibilities! 
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/rdpYmXA.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/rdpYmXA.jpg)

We have had that for a while...

> 
> We have had that for a while...

The part used to only have one attach node, but now it has many.
But they all work after you place it.

> 
> But they all work after you place it.

They didn't used to. You couldn't be able to radially attach stuff.
Maybe it was the editor extinsions...
Yay I will get back into KSP nao!
Romfarer - please please *please*, bring back the docking camera! ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

> 
> Romfarer - please please *please*, bring back the docking camera! ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

Checked out [RasterPropMonitor](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117471-1-0-RasterPropMonitor-still-putting-the-A-in-IVA)? It has docking port cameras (and heaps of other features). It makes flying an entirely-IVA mission not only possible, but enjoyable.
Thanks, Squad. Brilliant job!

Wow, the changes to the heat system really strike me as overly convoluted for no significant benefit to gameplay.

Was tracking separate surface and internal temperatures (with potentially a third somewhere in between value as well) really necessary? What does that bring to the table that couldn't have been achieved by just reducing the thermal mass of parts and calling the previous value surface temperature instead? Isn't this just going to further confuse players as to how the heat system is actually working when it was already fairly obtuse?

Seems like a very strange thing for Squad to suddenly go realism crazy on given the number of abstractions present in the game in other areas, and without clear benefit to how the game plays. If anything, it seems like a step backwards that will make things less intuitive for players, and make the system more difficult to balance for Squad given the increased number of variables now involved.
